item.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 25.

The requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII for a two-thirds vote to consider a report from the Committee on Rules the same day it is presented to the House is waived with respect to any resolution reported on the legislative day of April 11, 2003, providing for consideration or disposition of a conference report to accompany the bill H.R. 1559.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-73, by Mrs. Myrick.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-73, by Mrs. Myrick.

summary.text: Waives a specified requirement of rule XIII to provide for consideration or disposition of a conference report to accompany H.R. 1559 (making emergency wartime supplemental appropriations for FY 2003).

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced in the House on April 10, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Waives a specified requirement of rule XIII to provide for consideration or disposition of a conference report to accompany H.R. 1559 (making emergency wartime supplemental appropriations for FY 2003).

bill.title: Waiving a requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules.

item.title: Waiving a requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
